Trial_Design.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups using either patient-specific instrumentation or conventional instrumentation.

Intervention.evidence: using either patient-specific instrumentation or conventional instrumentation.

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that TKA performed with patient-specific instrumentation would improve patient-reported outcomes measured by validated scoring tools and level gait as ascertained with three-dimensional (3-D) analysis compared with conventional instrumentation 3 months after surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Patients were evaluated preoperatively and 3 months after surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups

Number_Randomised.evidence: We randomized 40 patients into two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: There were improvements from preoperatively to 3 months postoperatively in functional scores, QOL, and knee kinematic and kinetic gait parameters during level walking.
